analyzed: 至竟無所獲　　值佛乃安寧
translated: Yet in the end, I have gained nothing. Only after meeting the Buddha have I attained peace and tranquility.
The Za baozang jing (Miscellaneous Treasures Treasury Sutra) says:
In the past, there was a brāhman
who served the temple god day and night.
The god then asked,
What do you seek?
The brāhman said,
I now seek to become the chief priest of this god's sacrifices.
The god said,
There is a herd of cows there.

original: 汝問最前行者。🔽即如天語。
analyzed: 汝問最前行者。 即如天語。
translated: You should ask the one at the front.
He then went to ask that cow, just as the god had instructed.
Are you now suffering or happy?
The ox replied,

analyzed: 極為大苦。 刺刺兩肋。
translated: It is extremely painful.🔽The thorns pierce my two ribs.
The firewood bends my back and breaks it.
I pull the cart and carry heavy loads.
There is no rest.
He then asked again,
For what reason did you receive this ox form?
The ox replied,
I was the master of the heavenly sacrifice.
I indulged to the utmost and used the offerings for the heavenly sacrifice.
After death, I became an ox.
I received this suffering and distress.
Having heard these words, he returned to the heavens.
The gods then asked,
Do you now wish to be the master of the heavenly sacrifice?
The brahmin said,
I truly dare not do this after seeing this matter.
The gods said,
People's good and evil deeds each receive their own retribution.
The brahmin repented and
cultivated various good deeds, changing his past evil ways.
The Za bao zang jing says:
In the past there was an old man whose family was extremely wealthy.
This old man thought of obtaining meat to eat.
He deceitfully made an excuse, pointing to a tree in the field.
He told his sons,
The reason our family business has become prosperous
is due to the blessings and virtues of this tree spirit.

original: 今日汝等宜可群中取羊以用祭祀。
analyzed: 今日汝等宜可群中取羊以用祭祀。
translated: Today, you should all go to the herd and select a sheep to sacrifice to it.
At that time, the sons followed their father's instructions.
They immediately killed a sheep and made offerings to the tree.

original: 即於樹下立天祀舍。🔽其父後時壽盡命終。
analyzed: 即於樹下立天祀舍。 其父後時壽盡命終。
translated: They built a shrine for the tree god at the foot of the tree.

original: 行業所追還生己家羊群之中。
analyzed: 行業所追還生己家羊群之中。
translated: Later, their father's life ended and he was reborn in the herd of sheep in his own family.
At that time, the sons were about to make offerings to the tree god.
They selected a sheep.
They happened to get their father.
They were about to kill him.
The sheep choked and laughed, saying,
What kind of spiritual being is this tree?
In the past, because I thought of eating meat,
I deceitfully made you make offerings to it.
We all ate the meat together.
Now, I alone am repaying the karmic retribution
and am the first to suffer.
At that time, an arhat came to beg for food.
He saw the deceased father had been reborn as a sheep.

original: 即借主人道眼令自觀察。
analyzed: 即借主人道眼令自觀察。
translated: He borrowed the host's spiritual vision and had him observe it himself.
He then knew it was his father and felt distressed.
He destroyed the tree spirit and repented and cultivated merit.
He no longer killed living beings.

original: 3 祭祠部祭祠部第三如優婆塞戒經云。
analyzed: 3 祭祠部祭祠部第三如優婆塞戒經云。
translated: The Sacrificial Worship Section, Part 3, states:
The Buddha said:
Some say:
The son cultivates good dharmas while the father does evil.

original: 因子修善令父不墮三惡道者。
analyzed: 因子修善令父不墮三惡道者。
translated: Because the son cultivates goodness, he prevents the father from falling into the three evil paths.
This is not so. Why is it so?
Because the karmic retribution of body, speech, and mind is different.
If the father dies and falls into the realm of hungry ghosts,
The son seeks blessings for him.
One should know that he will then attain rebirth in the heavens.
He does not think of anything in the human realm.
Why is it so?
Because in the heavens, he attains supreme and wonderful treasures.
If he enters hell and suffers various torments,
He has no leisure to think of anything else.
Therefore, it is not obtained.
It is the same for animals and humans.
If it is said that hungry ghosts alone obtain it, why is it so?

original: 以其本有愛貪慳悋故墮餓鬼。
analyzed: 以其本有愛貪慳悋故墮餓鬼。
translated: Because they originally had love, greed, and stinginess, they fell into the realm of hungry ghosts.
Having become hungry ghosts, they always regret their past mistakes.
They think of wanting to obtain it.

analyzed: 是故得之。 若所為者。

analyzed: 生餘道中。 其餘眷屬。

their other relatives who have fallen into the realm of hungry ghosts

analyzed: 皆悉得之。 是故智者。

If there are sacrifices, who is the recipient?
The recipient is determined by the location of the sacrifice.
If it is near a forest, the tree spirit receives it.

original: 舍河泉井上林埠阜亦復如是。
analyzed: 舍河泉井上林埠阜亦復如是。
translated: It is the same for houses, rivers, springs, wells, hills, and mounds in the forest.
Even if a person performs a sacrifice, they will also obtain blessings and virtues.
Why is it so?
Because it causes the recipient to give rise to a joyful mind.
This sacrificial merit and virtue can protect one's body and wealth.
If it is said that killing and sacrificing can bring blessings,
This meaning is not so.
Why is it so?

original: 不見世人種伊蘭子生旃檀樹。

one should use fragrant flowers, milk, curd, ghee, and fruits.
For the deceased, there are three times for pursuing blessings:
The spring season is the first month,
the summer season is the fifth month,
and the autumn season is the ninth month.

original: 若以房舍臥具湯藥園林池井牛羊象馬種種資生。🔽布施於他。

lasting for a long time,
and blessings and virtues are constantly born.

This meaning is not so.

The objects are lost in two situations: when they are destroyed or not used,
but not lost when one's life ends.
If an ordained person imitates a layperson,
On the days of the year, abandoning food and drink,
It is for the sake of worldly dharmas, not true reality.

Because in the heavens, they have accomplished the most wonderful treasures.
If one enters hell and experiences various sufferings,

The same is true for animals.

analyzed: 故娑沙論。 為餓鬼作福。

their food is not the same.

when their relatives make offerings for them,
the power of the hungry ghosts' karma

analyzed: 有人不如法求財及其得時。

because of their stinginess,
they have no intention of giving even to their own relatives,
let alone other people.
Because they have no intention of giving,
When their bodies perish and their lives end, they fall into the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: 若在本舍邊不淨糞穢廁溷中住。
analyzed: 若在本舍邊不淨糞穢廁溷中住。
translated: They dwell in the filthy excrement and latrines beside their former homes.
Their relatives and friends feel sorrowful,
and think like this:
They accumulated wealth but did not enjoy it themselves.
They also did not give to others.
Out of sorrow, they want to give them food.

original: 請諸眷屬親友知識沙門婆羅門施其飲食。
analyzed: 請諸眷屬親友知識沙門婆羅門施其飲食。
translated: They invite their relatives, friends, acquaintances, śramaṇas, and brāhmaṇas to give them food and drink.
At that time, the hungry ghosts see this with their own eyes.
They give rise to the thought that the wealth belongs to them.
They think like this:
This wealth was accumulated by me.
Now I give it to others, and my heart is filled with great joy.

original: 於福田所生信敬心若生餘道多不得力。
analyzed: 於福田所生信敬心若生餘道多不得力。

it is still beneficial to cultivate goodness oneself.
It is like giving rise to kindness and always obtaining blessings for oneself.
Moreover, the Treatise on the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: 如慈心念諸眾生令得快樂。
analyzed: 如慈心念諸眾生令得快樂。
translated: It is like the mind of loving-kindness that thinks of all sentient beings and causes them to attain happiness.
Although sentient beings do not obtain anything, the one who thinks of them
obtains great merit.
If one does not enjoy giving,
even if one is reborn in the heavens or attains sagehood, one will still lack clothing and food.
Therefore, the Upāsaka Precepts Sutra says:

original: 持戒雖得羅漢不遮飢苦。
analyzed: 持戒雖得羅漢不遮飢苦。
translated: Even if one attains arhatship by upholding the precepts, one cannot escape the suffering of hunger.
If reborn in the heavens, one cannot obtain the best food and adornments.
If one enjoys practicing giving,
even if one falls into the realm of ghosts or animals, one will always be full and without lack.
Moreover, the Sutra of the Unprecedented says:
A king said to the Buddha:
My father, the previous king, served non-Buddhist paths.
He always practiced giving to seek the blessings of Brahma Heaven.
In what heavens are such merits born?
The Buddha told the king:
The previous king's karmic retribution is now in hell.
Why is this? He did not encounter a good time,
did not meet a good friend,
and had no skillful means.
Although he cultivated merits, he could not escape his crimes.
The merit of giving is not lost.
When the punishment is completed, one will then receive the blessings.
Know that cultivating blessings does not mix with offenses.

original: 先帝大王有五種惡業生地獄中。
analyzed: 先帝大王有五種惡業生地獄中。
translated: The previous emperor, the great king, had five kinds of evil karma and was born in hell.
First, he was arrogant and jealous.
Whether the matter was coarse or fine,
he would immediately raise his whip and punish without forbearance.
Second, he greedily accepted precious goods.
He judged matters unfairly,
causing resentment in the world.
Third, he indulged in hunting and play,
harassing the people,
harming the cherished lives of sentient beings.
Fourth, he was addicted to women,
disliking the old once he got the new,
treating them unfairly and causing resentment.
Fifth, he broke the precepts.

original: 以此文證故知事邪修福。
analyzed: 以此文證故知事邪修福。
translated: Based on this text, it is known that cultivating blessings through deviant practices
the good and evil are always separate.
The two retributions of suffering and joy are not mixed up.
How much more so for those with sharp faculties and much learning,
who have right faith in the Three Jewels but attract the retribution of suffering.
Moreover, the Wuyin sanmei jing says:
The Buddha told Ānanda:
Good man!
When a person seeks the Way and practices meditation, they should first cut off thoughts.

original: 人生世間所以不得道者。
analyzed: 人生世間所以不得道者。
translated: The reason why people in the world do not attain the Way
is simply because of the abundance of defiled thoughts.
One thought comes and one thought goes.

original: 一日一宿有八億四千萬念。
analyzed: 一日一宿有八億四千萬念。
translated: In one day and one night, there are 840 million thoughts.
Thoughts do not cease.
A single wholesome thought
also results in a wholesome karmic retribution.
A single unwholesome thought
also results in an unwholesome karmic retribution, like an echo responding to a sound,
like a shadow following a form.
Therefore, wholesome and unwholesome deeds, and blessings and sins, are each distinct.
Moreover, the Madhyama Agama Sutra says:
If one makes offerings and sacrifices for the dead,
if they are reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts, they will obtain food.
Excluding other realms, they will not obtain it.
Because each has food to sustain their life.
If no relatives are reborn in that realm,
the donor will obtain the blessings themselves.
Even if the donor is reborn in the six realms,
the blessings of giving will always follow.
Because of upholding the precepts,

analyzed: 雖得人身必須餘福助報也。
translated: Although one may obtain a human body, one must rely on other merits to assist in the retribution.

After death, creating merit,
the deceased obtains one-seventh of the merit.
The rest belongs to the current creator.
Moreover, the Sutra of the Crown Prince states:
Ānanda asked the Buddha, saying:

original: 若人命終送著山野造立墳塔。
analyzed: 若人命終送著山野造立墳塔。
translated: If after a person's death their body is sent to the mountains or wilderness to build a tomb or stupa,
is that person's spirit present within it?
The Buddha said:
It is both present and not present.

original: 若人生時不造善根不識三寶。
analyzed: 若人生時不造善根不識三寶。
translated: If a person during their lifetime does not create wholesome roots, does not recognize the Three Jewels,
and does not do evil,
there is no wholesome merit to be received,
and no evil retribution to be suffered.
There are no wholesome friends
to cultivate merit for them.

original: 是以精魂在塚塔中未有去處。
analyzed: 是以精魂在塚塔中未有去處。
translated: Therefore, their spirit is in the tomb or stupa without going anywhere else.
For this reason, it is said to be present.
Or, in their previous lives while in the world,
they greatly cultivated wholesome merit and diligently practiced the Way.
They may be reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials,
and receive blessings there.
Or they may be reborn in a wealthy family in the human realm.
Wherever they are, they naturally arise according to their wishes.
And those who are not there,
Or in their previous lives in the world,
Killing living beings, praying for blessings, not believing in the true Dharma,
Living a deviant life, flattering and deceiving others,
Fall into the realms of hungry ghosts and animals.
Suffering all kinds of hardships,
Experiencing hell,
Therefore it is said that they are not in the tombs and stupas.
And those who are not there,

analyzed: 或是五穀之骨未朽爛時。
translated: Or when the bones of the five grains have not yet decayed,
There is a subtle spirit.
If the bones rot,
This spirit perishes.
There is no spiritual power.
It cannot bring misfortune or blessings to people.
When the spirit has not perished,
It may be a relative.
The person who has passed away has no blessings in the world.
And practicing deceit should fall into the realm of ghosts and spirits.
Or become the essence of trees and various objects.
Having no heavenly blessings to enjoy,
Not included in hell,
Even if they leave the world and wander among human villages,
Since they have no food,
they fear disturbing people.
They create various strange phenomena to agitate people's minds.

original: 或有妖魅邪師以倚為福。
analyzed: 或有妖魅邪師以倚為福。
translated: There may be evil spirits and heretical teachers who rely on them for blessings.
Seeking various blessings and merits,
they wish to attain longevity.
Out of foolish and wrong views, they kill living beings and make sacrifices.
After death, they enter the hells, hungry ghosts, or animal realms.
There is no time for escape.
Shouldn't one be cautious about this?
Moreover, if a person is about to die,
incense should be burned and lamps lit to continue the light,
on the top of the flagpole in a temple or monastery.
The leader should pass on the banner,
and recite the revered sutras.
After three weeks,
the reason for this is as follows.
The person who has passed away is in the intermediate state,
with a body like a small child, and their sins and merits are not yet determined.
Merits should be cultivated on their behalf.

original: 願亡者生神使生十方無量剎土。
analyzed: 願亡者生神使生十方無量剎土。
translated: It is wished that the deceased's spirit will be reborn in the innumerable buddha lands in the ten directions.

original: 承此功德必得往生。🔽亡者在世。

By the merit of banners and lamps, one will surely attain liberation.
If there are good wishes,

up to the attainment of enlightenment.

their blessings are immeasurable.
When the banner turns once,
The position of a wheel-turning king.

The suffering beings who receive this light.

Based on this merit and virtue.
Rescue those beings.

Moreover, the Jingdu Sanmei Jing says:

analyzed: 復值四王十五日三十日所奏。

Those who commit offenses on the eight kings' days before the fast.

The heavens dispatch benevolent spirits to protect their bodies.

We always eat people.
Now that we are not allowed to kill,
what food should we eat?

As long as you do not kill,
I order my disciples to always give you food.
Until the Dharma perishes,
by my power I will make you feel full.

To provide food for sentient beings and to save the hungry ghosts in the wilderness.

Hungry ghosts can obtain a little food and drink from people,
And then transform it to make it abundant, allowing them to be satisfied.

The Buddha and Ananda

In the past, there was a Brahmin couple.

There will be three more deaths in the family.
A neighbor had an event and invited a Daoist priest.
His surname was Wei and his name was Pu.
He often deceived the villagers with talismans and spells.
He said to Ling:
Your family's misfortune is not over yet.
It is because you follow the bright gods.
If you serve the Great Way, you will surely receive blessings.
If you do not change your mind, your family will be destroyed in the future.

original: 齡遂亟延祭酒罷不奉法。
analyzed: 齡遂亟延祭酒罷不奉法。
translated: Ling then quickly invited the Daoist priest to stop following the Dharma.
Pu said:
You should burn the scriptures and images.
Then the disaster will be removed.
He then closed the doors of the monastery and set fire to it.
The flames raged for days.
But what was burned was only the building.
The scriptures, images, banners, and seats remained as they were.
The image emitted light in the middle of the night.
At that time, there were about twenty Daoist priests.

original: 亦有懼畏靈驗密委去者。
analyzed: 亦有懼畏靈驗密委去者。
translated: Some were afraid of the spiritual manifestations and secretly left.
But Wei Po-ch'e and his disciples still had strong intentions and did not stop.
They disheveled their hair, took seven steps, and held knives and ropes.
They said, We expel the Buddha and return him to the Hu country.
He is not allowed to stay in China to harm the people.

original: 齡於其夕如有人歐打之者。
analyzed: 齡於其夕如有人歐打之者。
translated: That night, it was as if someone had beaten Wei Po-ch'e.
He suddenly collapsed on the ground.
His family members helped him up and showed him the remaining breath.
He then fell to the side and was unable to move.
The Daoist priest Wei Po-ch'e.

original: 其時體內發疽日出二升。
analyzed: 其時體內發疽日出二升。
translated: At that time, an abscess erupted inside his body and two pints of pus came out every day.
In less than a month, he died in pain.
His companions all contracted leprosy.

original: 其隣人東安太守水丘和。
analyzed: 其隣人東安太守水丘和。
translated: The neighbor, Shui Qiu He, the Prefect of Dong'an,
It was transmitted to Dongyang without doubt.

analyzed: 時亦多有見者右一人出冥祥記。
translated: At that time, there were also many who saw it.

He became a monk at a young age.
When he was first a novice,
there was a physiognomist.
He was good at physiognomy.
He said to Master Yan,

original: 阿師子雖大聰明智慧鋒銳。
analyzed: 阿師子雖大聰明智慧鋒銳。
translated: Although you are very intelligent and have sharp wisdom,
your life is short and you will not live for more than ten days.
When Master Yan heard these words,
he then invited many virtuous monks to discuss together,
What merit is most superior in prolonging life?
The virtuous monks replied,

original: 依佛聖教受持金剛般若經。
analyzed: 依佛聖教受持金剛般若經。
translated: According to the teachings of the Buddha, if you uphold the Diamond Prajna Paramita Sutra,
its merits are the greatest.
If you can uphold it well, you will definitely benefit from prolonging your life.
Master Yan accepted the order and entered the mountains to make a vow.
With body and mind, he upheld the Prajna Paramita Sutra.
After five years, he saw his life extended.
Later, when he came out of the mountains, he met the physiognomist again.
The physiognomist was surprised.
He then said to Yanshi,

original: 比來修何功德得壽命長。
analyzed: 比來修何功德得壽命長。
translated: What merits have you cultivated in the past to have such a long lifespan?
Yanshi fully explained his previous intentions.
Therefore, he attained this.
The physiognomist marveled and rejoiced unceasingly.
Later, Yanshi's learning and inquiries became extensive.
He skillfully propagated the sutras and treatises, guiding and investigating the Buddha's teachings.
He became a great virtuous one who upheld the Dharma.
He lived to be over ninety years old.
